automatic_ordering.reasoning: We examined the session names and noticed that they come in groups as indicated by their name parts. There are two groups for encounters with Jaheira – one labeled 'SiegeCombat' and the other 'IsobelCombat' – and a group for FlamingSpy (labeled 'IsobelCombat', but triggered by fighting S_HAV_FlamingSpy). Within each group, the sessions are numbered 000, 001, and 002, which strongly suggests a sequential progression where 000 comes before 001 and 001 before 002. Moreover, since the two Jaheira groups are triggered in similar combat situations (fighting S_Player_Jaheira) but represent alternative dialogue branches, it is logical to assume that they are mutually exclusive – only one of these branches can be experienced in any single playthrough. The FlamingSpy sessions, however, form a continuous chain with no alternative branch. Based on this analysis, we establish ordering rules within each numerical chain and an exclusiveness rule between the two alternative Jaheira branches.

AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_002_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_002_0.text: If we fall, the Absolute wins!

AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_000_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_000_0.text: If Isobel falls, we all die.

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001_0.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001_0.text: General Ketheric wants her alive - at any cost!

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002_0.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002_0.text: The General will be pleased if you go quietly.

AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_000_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_000_0.text: This fight is winnable. Do not stop!

AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_002_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_IsobelCombat_002_0.text: Rout the Absolute's poison from this place.

AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_001_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_001_0.text: These shades are nothing to Those Who Harp.
